c:atomType.name: AxisDomainAlign
c:atomType.c:documentation:
The domain alignment, used to decide which values to keep or to view, for options like FixedLength (see and ) and Ratio (see ).
This only applies when the domain has some order among its elements, and, consequently, some minimum and maximum values.

c:atom.name: Min
c:atom.c:documentation: If necessary, the domain will be cut in a way that the smallest values will allways be kept, and the maximum is discarded.

c:atom.name: Max
c:atom.c:documentation: If necessary, the domain will be cut in a way that the biggest values will allways be kept, and the minimum is discarded.

c:atom.name: Center
c:atom.c:documentation: If necessary, the domain will be cut by computing the central values, discarding both minimum and maximum.
